abstract: A jury trial began over how much SAP will pay in damages to Oracle in a copyright scheme. Oracle has argued for $2 billion; SAP has set aside $160 million.
snippet: A jury trial began over how much SAP will pay in damages to Oracle in a copyright scheme. Oracle has argued for $2 billion; SAP has set aside $160 million.
lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif.  The dispute between the software giants Oracle and SAP, in one of the most closely watched court cases in Silicon Valley history, is not over whether SAP engaged in a copyright infringement scheme, but over how much damage was done to Oracle.

headline.main: Trial Opens Over Damages in Oracle Copyright Case With SAP
headline.print_headline: Trial Opens Over Damages in Oracle Copyright Case With SAP
